properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 10 at 8:50PM EST until February 13 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh PA
properties.description:
...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in
Pennsylvania...

Ohio River At Pittsburgh affecting Allegheny County.

.The Ohio River at Pittsburgh is expected to rise above 18 feet
overnight due to recent rainfall, flooding the Monongahela Parking
Wharf. The threat for additional rainfall and subsequent rise will
prompt the continuation of the advisory through the end of the week,
despite a brief period where the Point may fall below 18 feet.

For the Ohio River...including Pittsburgh, Dashields, Montgomery,
East Livertest, East Liverpool, Wellsville, New Cumberland,
Steubenville, Wellsburg, Pike Island, Wheeling, Moundsville,
Powhatan Point, Hannibal...elevated river levels are forecast.

The Flood Advisory continues for
the Ohio River At Pittsburgh.
* Until late Wednesday night.
* At 8:30 PM EST Monday the stage was 17.4 feet.
* Action stage is 18.0 feet.
* Flood stage is 25.0 feet.
* Forecast...The river will rise to 19.0 feet tomorrow evening. It
will then fall to 17.5 feet and begin rising again Thursday
morning. It will rise to 19.0 feet Friday morning. It will then
fall again and remain below flood stage.
* Impact...At 18.0 feet, Water begins to flow onto the Monongahela
Parking Wharf.
* Impact...At 19.0 feet, Water begins to flow onto the north shore
riverwalk between the stadiums.
* Impact...At 19.5 feet, The Mon Parking Wharf is completely flooded.
* Impact...At 20.0 feet, Water is up to one foot deep in the lower
areas of the North Shore Riverwalk.
properties.instruction:
This Flood Advisory means river flows are elevated.  Heed any road
closures.

Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz.

NWSheadline: The Flood Advisory is now in effect until early Thursday morning
